intro: Silene alba var. rothmaleriana, commonly known as the white campion, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in its native environment.
